Taewoo

Introduction

Taewoo is a South Korean singer-songwriter and rapper under MECHIVE. He made his solo debut on May 23, 2021 with his first digital single "Pause".
In 2019, he was a contestant on Channel A's survival show Vocal Play 2 and finished in the top 16.

In 2021 and 2022, he competed as SingAgain2 Singer No.42 on JTBC's survival show Sing Again 2 and finished in the top 26.

In 2024, he was a contestant on Mnet's survival show Build Up : Vocal Boy Group Survivor and finished in the top 30. He performed "Thought of You" by John Park as V28, "Beautiful" by Crush, "Downpour" by I.O.I, and "Forest" by Choi Yuree during the show.

Fun facts

1
Taewoo performed "Forest" (by Choi Yuree) with Neon and Lim Sang Hyun for the Triple Death Match Mission during episode 6 of Mnet's survival show Build Up : Vocal Boy Group Survivor on March 1, 2024.
…
2
Taewoo performed "Downpour" (by I.O.I) with Lim Sang Hyun for the 2vs2 Rival Mission during episode 5 of Mnet's survival show Build Up : Vocal Boy Group Survivor on February 23, 2024.
…
3
Taewoo performed "Beautiful" (Goblin / Guardian OST by Crush) with Kim Min Seo, Jung Yoon Seo, and Lim Sang Hyun for the PRE-4 Mission during episode 2 of Mnet's survival show Build Up : Vocal Boy Group Survivor on February 2, 2024.
…
4
Taewoo has done multiple English interviews on Arirang Radio Sound K, Radio' Clock with Ashley of Ladies' Code & Yunhway, and Radio'n Us with Samuel Seo.
…
5
Taewoo performed "Thought of You" (by John Park) as voice silhouette V28 in a teaser for Mnet's survival show Build Up : Vocal Boy Group Survivor starting on January 26, 2024.
…
6
Taewoo (as SingAgain2 Singer No.42) performed "The Downfall of Moon" (by Kim Hyun Chul), "You in Vague Memory" (by Hyun Jin Young), "Love Love Love" (by Kim Hyun Sik) with Beom Seung Hyeok, "Warm on a Cold Night" (by Honne), and "Speed" (by Kim Gun Mo) during JTBC's survival show Sing Again 2 in 2021/2022.
…
7
Taewoo performed "comethru" (by Jeremy Zucker), "Whatever", "Wi-Fi" (by Yoon Jong Shin & Block B's Zico) with Kim Minseo & Yang Dohu, "Dry Flower", "The Dance in the Rhythm" (by Kim Wan Sun), and "Butterfly" (by Loveholics) with other top 16 contestants during Channel A's survival show Vocal Play 2: Campus Music Olympiad in 2019.
…
